## Example: Mission & Principles {.smaller}

```{.markdown}
# Replication Package Agent

## Mission
Transform the messy project folder into an AER-compliant replication
package. Reorganize code, write documentation, create a master script,
and produce all tables and figures in a clean, reproducible pipeline.

## Principles
1. Never delete the original data files. Copy them to data/raw/.
2. All code must run from the project root using relative paths.
3. Use R with tidyverse conventions. Load packages with library().
4. Output tables as both .csv and .tex (using modelsummary).
5. Output figures as both .pdf and .png (300 DPI).
6. Follow the AEA README template structure exactly.
7. Document every decision in the README.
```

# Part 3: Commands, Skills & Permissions {background-color="#2D3748"}


## Slash Commands (Claude Code) {.center}

| Command | What It Does |
|---------|-------------|
| **`/plan`** | Enter planning mode --- drafts approach, waits for approval |
| **`/compact`** | Compress conversation to save context |
| **`/insights`** | What the agent learned about your project |
| **`/cost`** | Show API cost for this session |
| **`/model`** | Switch between opus / sonnet / haiku |
| **`/your-skill`** | Run a custom skill from `.claude/skills/` or `.claude/commands/` |

## Custom Skills {.center}

Create reusable project-specific commands in `.claude/commands/`:

```{.markdown filename=".claude/commands/check-package.md"}
Verify that the replication package is AER-compliant:

1. Check README.md exists and follows the AEA template
2. Check all scripts referenced in README exist
3. Run master.R and verify it completes without errors
4. Check that all output files are produced
5. Report pass/fail for each item
```

Now type **`/check-package`** and the agent runs the full checklist!

## settings.json Allow-list {.center}

```{.json filename=".claude/settings.json"}
{
  "permissions": {
    "allow": [
      "Bash(Rscript:*)", "Bash(R:*)",
      "Bash(mkdir:*)", "Bash(cp:*)", "Bash(mv:*)",
      "Bash(make:*)", "Write(*)", "Read(*)"
    ]
  }
}
```

The agent can run R, create directories, read/write files --- but will ask before `rm`, `pip install`, `git push`, etc.

## What the AER README Needs {.center}

```{=html}
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 12px; max-width: 900px; margin: 4px auto;">

    <li>Statement about Rights</li>

    <li>Details / Dataset List</li>
  </ul>
</li>
<li>Computational Requirements</li>
<li>Description of Programs</li>
<li>Instructions to Replicators</li>
<li>Table/Figure â†’ Program Mapping</li>
<li>References</li>
</ol>
</div>

<div style="background: #FFF5F5; border-radius: 8px; padding: 10px 12px;">
<h4 style="margin: 0 0 4px 0; color: #9B2C2C; font-size: 0.8em;">Common Failures</h4>
<ul style="margin: 0; padding-left: 16px; color: #4A5568; font-size: 0.66em; line-height: 1.4;">
<li>âŒ Missing README sections</li>
<li>âŒ Code does not run</li>
<li>âŒ Hardcoded file paths</li>
<li>âŒ Missing data citations</li>
<li>âŒ No master script</li>
<li>âŒ Exploratory files included</li>
<li>âŒ Missing dependencies</li>
<li>âŒ Manual steps required</li>
</ul>
</div>

</div>

<div style="background: #EBF8FF; border: 2px solid #4299E1; border-radius: 8px; padding: 6px 12px; max-width: 700px; margin: 6px auto;">
<p style="margin: 0; color: #2A4365; font-size: 0.72em;">
<strong>The cardinal rule:</strong> "Reproduce tables and figures by running code without manual intervention, starting from raw data." --- AEA Data Editor
</p>
</div>
```

## Tips {.center}

```{=html}
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 16px; max-width: 820px; margin: 8px auto;">

<li>Skip the CLAUDE.md</li>
<li>Panic when it makes errors</li>
<li>Forget to test <code>master.R</code></li>
<li>Ignore the AER README template</li>
</ul>
```

## Bonus Challenges {.center}

::: {.panel-tabset}

### Challenge 1: Compare Agents
Run the same task with two different agents (Claude Code, Gemini CLI, or Codex CLI). Compare:

- Quality of the README
- Code organization choices
- Time to completion

### Challenge 2: Custom Skills
Create `.claude/commands/` with:

- `/check-package` --- verify AER compliance
- `/compare-output` --- summarize generated tables

### Challenge 3: Your Own Project
Take one of YOUR research projects and create a CLAUDE.md for it. Use the agent to reorganize it.

:::
